text:
East 138th Street at the N.W. corner of Grand Concourse (Mott
Ave.).
November 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: 138th Street (East) - Grand Concourse

text:
Grand Concourse (Mott Ave.), east side. East 138th Street, showing
in a set of two views, the Mott Haven station of the New York Central
Railroad. The view is in a northerly direction.

November 9, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 138th Street (East)

text:
Grand Concourse (Mott Ave.), east side. East 138th Street, showing
in a set of two views, the Mott Haven station of the New York Central
Railroad. The view is in a northerly direction.

November 9, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 138th Street (East)

text:
(1)
308 to 322 Grand Concourse (Mott Ave.), east side, between East 138th and 144th Streets. The 3-story frame structure bears No. 308 and the three brick houses, under demolition, bear Nos. 318 to 322.
November 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
An exclusive view of No. 308.
November 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 138th Street (East)

text:

title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 138th Street (East)

text:
346 and 348 Grand Concourse (Mott Ave.), east side, between East 138th and 144th Streets, showing a 2 and 3-story frame house.
November 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 138th Street (East)

text:
Grand Concourse (Mott Ave.), north from and including East 138th Street. On the right appears the Mott Haven station of the New York Central Railroad at the N.E. corner of the aforementioned thoroughfares.
November 29, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
An exclusive view of the Mott Haven station and part of the elevated structure of the railroad. The latter runs on Park Ave.
November 29, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 138th Street (East)

text:
E. 138th Street, south side, west from Grand Concourse to Exterior Street, showing the trailer camp being erected by the Works Progress Administration to accommodate the American Legion members, who arrived for their 1937 convention.
Sept. 14, 1937
W.P.A, Photo
Five Boroughs Project
(2)
The same, several days later.
Sept. 17, 1937
W.P.S. Photo
Five Boroughs Project
(3)
A view across the trailer camp at the south west corner of
Grand Concourse and E. 138th Street.
Sept.20, 1937
W.P.A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project

title: Bronx: 138th Street - Grand Concourse

text:
East 138th Street, at the S.W. corner of Grand Concourse. Note the free trailer camp for the members of the American Legion who arrived
here for their convention in the Summer of 1937.
September 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: 138th Street (East) - Grand Concourse

text:
(1)
E. 138th Street, at the S.W. corner of Grand Concourse, showing the W.P.A. erecting the registration office of the Bronx County American Legion during the Legion's 1937 National Convention.
September 14, 1937
W.P.A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project
(2)
The same, a few days later.
September 20, 1937
W.P.A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project
(2)
Another part of the Legion auto camp, near the New York Central tracks.
September 1937
W.P.A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project

title: Bronx: 138th Street (East) - Grand Concourse

text:
E. 138th Street, at he S.W.corner of Grand Concourse, showing the W. P. A. erecting a trailer camp to accommodate the American Legionnaires, who arrived for their 1937 convention. In rear of the camp is the New York Central Railroad bridge spanning the
Harlem River.
Sept.14,1937
W.P.A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project
(2)
The same, a few days later.
Sept.17, 1937
W.P.e, Photo
Five Boroughs Project
(3)
Part of the trailer camp site, viewed northwestward across E. 138th Street. The five story factory is at the N.W. corner
of Walton Avenue.
Sept. 14, 1937
W.P.S. Photo
Five Boroughs Project
